newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-VICENZA END 95-YEAR WAIT FOR ITALY CUP FINAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-VICENZA END 95-YEAR WAIT FOR ITALY CUP FINAL.

text.p: Veteran striker Giovanni Cornacchini sent Vicenza through to the first Italian Cup final of their 95-year history on Tuesday and dashed the hopes of Bologna, the club he played for last season.

The 31-year-old Cornacchini, who helped Bologna win promotion last season, rifled in a left-footed shot with just two minutes to go before injury time as the home team clung on after being reduced to 10 men in the 67th minute.
Vicenza, who have never won any silverware in the past and whose best previous achievement was to finish runners-up in the league in 1977-78, won the first leg 1-0.
But they have suffered a poor spell of form recently with just one point in three league matches. They are seventh in serie A, which they led briefly in November.
Bologna, beaten semifinalists last year as well, took the lead on the stroke of halftime when Giancarlo Marocchi passed to Cristiano Scapolo on the edge of the area.
Scapolo fired a diagonal shot across goal from the left of the box past diving goalkeeper Pierluigi Brivio.
Vicenza captain Giovanni Lopez was booked shortly afterwards and will miss the final against Internazionale or Napoli, having been cautioned previously in the tournament.
Napoli are at home to Inter on Wednesday night.
Bologna then dominated the first 10 minutes of the second half and, having easily overcome the setback of the 1-0 away defeat, looked destined to dash Vicenza's hopes.
But defender Giuseppe Cardone was the sent off for bringing down Massimo Beghetto who had a clear run on goal.
"We could have won it with Beghetto. It was a tough match but we stuck it out in the first 15 minutes of the first half," said the impassive Vicenza coach Francesco Guidolin.
"My compliments to Bologna...we must always remember that we are just Vicenza," he added with his usual humility.
